results.title: KCNJ16-depleted kidney organoids recapitulate tubulopathy and lipid recovery upon statins treatment.
results.text_hl: Drug screening revealed that treatment with statins, particularly the combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and C75, prevented @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ droplet accumulation and collagen-I deposition in @GENE_KCNJ16 @GENE_3773 @@@KCNJ16@@@-/- kidney @<m>DISEASE_Nevus_Sebaceous_of_Jadassohn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054000 @@@organoids@@@.

citations.NLM: Sendino Garví E, van Slobbe GJJ, Zaal EA, de Baaij JHF, Hoenderop JG, Masereeuw R, Janssen MJ, van Genderen AM. KCNJ16-depleted kidney organoids recapitulate tubulopathy and lipid recovery upon statins treatment. Stem Cell Res Ther. 2024 Aug 26;15(1):268. PMID: 39183338
citations.BibTeX: @article{39183338, title={KCNJ16-depleted kidney organoids recapitulate tubulopathy and lipid recovery upon statins treatment.}, author={Sendino Garví E and van Slobbe GJJ and Zaal EA and de Baaij JHF and Hoenderop JG and Masereeuw R and Janssen MJ and van Genderen AM}, journal={Stem Cell Res Ther}, volume={15}, number={1}, pages={268}}

results.title: CHILD syndrome mimicking verrucous nevus in a Chinese patient responded well to the topical therapy of compound of simvastatin and cholesterol.
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Congenital_Hemidysplasia_with_Ichthyosiform_Erythroderma_and_Limb_Defects @DISEASE_MESH:C562515 @@@CHILD syndrome@@@ mimicking @<m>DISEASE_Nevus_Sebaceous_of_Jadassohn</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054000 @@@verrucous nevus@@@ in a Chinese @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ responded well to the topical therapy of compound of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@.

citations.NLM: Yu X, Zhang J, Gu Y, Deng D, Wu Z, Bao L, Li M, Yao Z. CHILD syndrome mimicking verrucous nevus in a Chinese patient responded well to the topical therapy of compound of simvastatin and cholesterol. J Eur Acad Dermatol Venereol. 2018 Jul;32(7):1209-1213. PMID: 29341259
